sect3.title: Program Files
sect3.para: arp, dnsdomainname (link to hostname), domainname (link to hostname), hostname, ifconfig, nameif, netstat, nisdomainname (link to hostname), plipconfig, rarp, route, slattach and ypdomainname (link to hostname)

sect4.title: arp
sect4.para: arp is used to manipulate the kernel's ARP cache, usually to add or delete an entry, or to dump the ARP cache.

sect4.title: dnsdomainname
sect4.para: dnsdomainname shows the system's DNS domain name.

sect4.title: domainname
sect4.para: domainname shows or sets the system's NIS/YP domain name.

sect4.title: hostname
sect4.para: hostname prints or sets the name of the current host system.

sect4.title: ifconfig
sect4.para: The ifconfig command is the general command used to configure network interfaces.

sect4.title: nameif
sect4.para: nameif names network interfaces based on MAC addresses.

sect4.title: netstat
sect4.para: netstat is a multi-purpose tool used to print the network connections, routing tables, interface statistics, masquerade connections and multicast memberships.

sect4.title: nisdomainname
sect4.para: nisdomainname shows or sets system's NIS/YP domain name.

sect4.title: plipconfig
sect4.para: plipconfig is used to fine-tune the PLIP device parameters, hopefully making it faster.

sect4.title: rarp
sect4.para: Akin to the arp program, the rarp program manipulates the system's RARP table.

sect4.title: route
sect4.para: route is the general utility which is used to manipulate the IP routing table.

sect4.title: slattach
sect4.para: slattach attaches a network interface to a serial line, i.e.. puts a normal terminal line into one of several "network" modes.

sect4.title: ypdomainname
sect4.para: ypdomainname shows or sets the system's NIS/YP domain name.
